Course Description: The purpose of this course is to develop advanced techniques in the design and analysis of algorithms. It will focus on exploring both the breadth of theoretical tools necessary for computer science as well as the depth through analysis of the related data structure and algorithms.

Prerequisites.Mandatory: CSE102 Advance Data structures and Algorithms

Course Outcomes.CO1: Understand some higher level theoretical concepts used in computer science.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Develop the skill to analyse and mathematically prove algorithmic facts.
Course Outcomes.CO3: (Graduate version) Be able to appreciate and understand theoretical sections of research papers.
Course Outcomes.CO4: (Graduate version) Be able to appreciate and understand theoretical sections of research papers.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: String matching – Introduction, Rabin Karp, KMP
Numerical algorithms – GCD, Euclidean alg., Extended Euclid, Modular arithmetic
Numerical algorithms – Chinese remainder th., Euler’s th., Fermat’s th., RSA, Diffie-Hellman
Overflow week OR Integer factorization, AKS polytime primality algorithm
Linear programming – intro, slack form, normal form
Flow networks – max flow min cut
Flow networks – max flow min cut algorithms
Bipartite matching and maximum bipartite matching
